title: Charges possible over fatal film-set shooting
content: A US prosecutor says "all options are on the table" over the shooting involving actor Alec Baldwin.

title: Petrol stations ration fuel in China shortage
content: It is likely to contribute to the global supply chain crisis and inflation, analysts told the BBC.

title: UK says French fishing threats would break law
content: The Brexit minister seeks "urgent clarification" after France says it will block ports to UK boats.

title: Humans turning forests into carbon sources
content: Human activity and wildfires have turned protected forests into net sources of carbon, a study suggests.

title: Cavallo on coming out as gay: 'It's my freedom day'
content: Josh Cavallo has come out as gay - the only current top level male professional footballer to do so.

title: No more super skyscrapers, says China
content: The decision is being seen as part of a larger bid to crackdown on vanity projects.

title: World Bank freezes cash to Sudan after coup
content: Pressure mounts on the military to restore civilian rule as international bodies respond.

title: Start-up launches £495,000 hoverbike in Japan
content: The Tokyo-based company hopes the vehicle will rival the popularity of supercars.

title: Chinese missile launch very concerning - US general
content: It is the first acknowledgement by Washington of claims that China conducted two missile tests.

title: Poland told to pay €1m a day in legal row with EU
content: The ruling is the latest step in an escalating dispute over Poland's legal reforms.

title: Koeman sacked as Barcelona manager
content: Ronald Koeman is sacked as head coach of Barcelona after 14 months in charge at the Nou Camp following a defeat by Rayo Vallecano.

title: Clinton aide details unwanted kiss from US senator
content: In a new book, Huma Abedin says the senator made an unwelcome advance after inviting her into his home.

title: Pope to visit Canada for indigenous reconciliation
content: The visit follows renewed attention on indigenous children who died at residential schools.
